summary: Performance regression from SDK version 1.13.1 to 1.13.2 causes significant CPU degradation in worker processing despite no obvious changes in the release. A comment suggests a lazy-loaded module added in 1.13.2 may be responsible.
userImpact: Users experience significant CPU usage degradation and performance degradation when upgrading from 1.13.1 to 1.13.2, impacting worker efficiency.
rootCause: A lazy-loaded module that was added in 1.13.2 is suspected to be causing the performance regression.
proposedFix: Try version 1.14.1 where the lazy-loaded module was removed, which may resolve the regression.
workaround: Revert to SDK version 1.13.1 with the patch from PR #1834 to maintain performance.
keyQuote: Updating to `1.13.2` shows a significant degradation in performance. We removed a lazy loaded module that was added in `1.13.2` that might be behind the regression you saw.
